message: by the way... do you call 'em pubs in US? :)
Any chance we could organize a pub crawl on one of the first nights? Would be great for first timers like me :)

@jamespaxi mostly in Atlanta we call them bars (this might be wildly out of line with what people in other parts of the states do—see our way of calling any carbonated soft-drink Coke—but I don't think so). What the owner calls it usually depends on the vibe s?he is trying to project. We've got pubs, brewpubs, bars, cocktail lounges, speak-easies, you-name-it.
I hope it lives up to expectations :-)
@gthank Hi thanks for the reply, I'm quite excited by the whole trip :)
@gthank thanks! :) Do you reckon other chaps might want to go for a drink as it gets dark, or are most people going to just code all night? :)

First timer?  Don't worry. Many of us go out when it gets dark.  There are quite a few bars within walking distance and on Saturday night, we pretty much stay in the hotel and drink due to Georgia's alcohol laws.  Bars start closing around 10pm on Saturday night because of their Sunday alcohol laws.  Welcome to the deep south!
Yeah, they take "the South shall rise again" pretty seriously -- and it's tough to do any serious rising on a hung-over Monday morning.

@JeffSelf I don't think that many bars close early on Saturday because of our (lamentable) blue laws. I think it's more a function of the location: downtown is mostly a business district. If you migrate a little north (Midtown, and especially Buckhead) or east (Little 5 Points, Virginia Highlands, or Decatur) you quickly find bars that are open until the wee, WEE hours of the morning.
@jamespaxi Pub, bar, bar and grill, sports bar, cantina, tavern, watering hole, brew pub, ale house, tap room ... everybody will know what you're talking about.
@JeffSelf woah I guess there will be quite the scene at the hotel Saturday night hehe
I'll bring some Flor de Caña http://www.flordecana.com/index.php

@gthank Really?  We were kicked out of the bar last year by 11 on Saturday night. We were shocked when the waitress said last call around 10:30.  On Friday night, that bar was packed. Maybe they just wanted to go home I guess.
@JeffSelf Oh, Max Lager's does close pretty early, though (it's the one right downtown by the hotel).

@JeffSelf Most business-district bars I've been in close early, so I'm assuming the same is true here in Atlanta. The last time I was doing any serious bar-hopping, I was definitely out past 1 (that would be in the burbs about 6 years ago). Quick googling of some Buckhead locations shows them open to 3 on Fridays, 2 all the other days.
@JeffSelf Looking for the hours at the bars mentioned on the PyCon site now.
(i think we might have talked about that in another thread)
@briancurtin yup... here? http://www.reddit.com/r/Python/comments/fu038/hey_rpython_is_anyone_heading_to_pycon/c1iw810 :)

@jamespaxi Nothing much going on, on that front. I had wanted to finish a migration before PyCon but, it's not gonna happen. Too much happening at work and home to do much programming in my "spare" time ;-)
@gthank yes please, by the sounds of it it would be very useful.

Also, I didn't put it on the page, but if you like live blues, you might consider http://www.northsidetavern.com/home_1.html. It's definitely got a dive bar vibe, but the music was good back when I lived nearby.
Should I update that page to put the hours on there?
I'd be thrilled to try either.

@JeffSelf The Porter Beer Bar is open late (2:30 am) on Fri. and Sat. The BrickStore Pub is open until 2. The bar at 5 seasons is open until midnight (1 from Thursday through Saturday). Twain's is 2 (3 on Friday). H Harper Station is 1:30. Eastside Lounge is 2:30 (3 on Fri. and Sat.).
http://us.pycon.org/2011/venue/bars/ lists some bars that may be of interest.
hey @gthank! Just realized you are the one who pointed me to Convore on Reddit :) How's the REAL ULTIMATE POWER blog going? hehe
@gthank - The Porter was awesome last year. It gets pretty crowded but has a great selection.
I'll be crawling away from the pub when we're done. Or drug out by the local authorities. Depends.
Personally, I expect I'll be hanging out Friday for dinner, and possibly for a bit on Sunday afternoon, and I haven't had a chance to visit The Porter or H. Harper Station, yet.
Hmm… looks like my edit rights on the PyCon bar page are gone. Wonder if the whole thing is read-only right now or something.
Edit rights back (browser flakiness?) so the hours will soon be on the page.
Hours are there now: http://us.pycon.org/2011/venue/bars/
dragged* ;)
Oh!  Put this on the page - live blues in Atlanta... how do I get there?
*sigh*. yeah yeah
@gthank thanks for that! :)
Count me in for such festivities.
@gthank ... sorry;  I was talking about the northside tavern....
As a PyCon rookie myself a pub crawl sounds like a great idea, when do people want to meet up?

@yarkot I'd plan to take a cab (at least on the way back), although it is walkable if you don't mind a stroll through some poorly lit areas. Please don't do that alone, though. I've never personally witnessed any trouble in the area, but better safe than sorry. I'm adding info to the official site now.
Added more info to the official page. Now it mentions a couple of places to catch live blues, and one for jazz.
@gthank - it's going to be a busy PyCon, but I'm thinking  Sat. night... 10 or 11PM to 1 or 2... might be a good blues time ;-)
@yarkot It probably will be ;-) Sadly, I can't make it (got a young baby at home).
BTW, Danny "Mudcat" Dudek is an awesome performer, and he'll be there Wednesday night (I think his full band won't be playing a Saturday until the last weekend in the month).
@gthank Congratulations! :-)
@yarkot Thanks. I'll be helping with the networking grunt work tomorrow evening. Will you be at the hotel by then?
@gthank Thats the one.

@JeffSelf Yes, Max Lager's is definitely targeting the business demographic, which makes sense given their location. I liked the beer the last time I was in—I was in luck and they had their Scotch ale, which is excellent, on tap—but in my mind it's more of a "long lunch" destination than a "going out all night" kind of place. I hope the PyCon page is more of a help this year. :-)
Taco Mac is only a few blocks away as well... Largest beer selection in Atlanta that I know of and really good food :)
Also, the vortex.
Taco Mac and Gordon Biersche. And for Thursday / Friday, I live down by the Crescent Club / Bar District.
anyone going out tomorrow? :)
I want a mint julep.
See you all chaps! :)
@lvh they're… interesting, if you haven't had one before. H. Harper Station has a good reputation for cocktails, especially traditional cocktails, though I don't have first-hand experience. Yet.
@gthank Willing to dress up as the Colonel and fake the accent. I figure GA is far enough down south.
Steel Restaurant and Lounge near Midtown Station has a Sushi Happy Hour on Wednesdays from 5-7pm.
it's a bit of a hike from the hotel though
Fat Matt's Rib Shack is an awesome place if you're into BBQ or The Blues: http://fatmattsribshack.com/
@lvh Juleps are great! make them use a good Bourbon. A bar tender who can make a good one is hard to find.
directions: http://goo.gl/maps/vGKh
I like Woodford Reserve in mine
It's even harder to find the traditional drinking vessel; a stirling silver cup :)
My wife bought me a set. It really does taste better.
+1 on the Taco Mac suggestion
Aha. I knew I'd seen it, and now I've found it: The Thirsty Guide to Atlanta http://www.thirstysouth.com/thirsty-guide-to-atlanta/
Cross-posting on Taco Mac midtown: https://convore.com/pycon-2011/can-anyone-recommend-some-good-restaurants-in-the-area/313122/

I'm particularly interested in hitting up H. Harper Station—an excellent choice for getting a julep, by what I hear http://www.thirstysouth.com/2010/11/18/h-harper-station-a-scenic-ride/ ;-)—and The Porter Beer Bar.
Hey, so is anyone planning on doing the alcohol drinking thing tonight?
@guido There is a group heading out at 7pm to manuels tavern. https://convore.com/pycon-2011/pyatl-social-thursday-night-manuels-tavern/ Not sure of any other festivities other than that.
Sounds great. I've decided to not be so shy this year. :-)
@guido See you at 7!
If coffee is more your speed, there's a latte art competition on Thursday's at Octane http://www.octanecoffee.com/. I believe it starts at 8.
@jamespaxi I'm in the main hall. Care to meet up?
Anybody want to grab a brew at Max Lager's during lunch?
@gthank, dammit, lunch is over, otherwise I would have said yes!
Not a full-on pubcrawl, though
food & beer after lightening talks?
See the Scotch BoF
@gthank hey, I have been locked out of the internet most of the time here. So haven't checked convore much.
@gthank where you guys off to? Meeting other peeps around 7
Some of us are making a dinner + buying run.
Where meeting?
upstairs between elevators & doors, 5 min after lightening talks
hacking for freedom..... Hanover C and it's awesome
